entry.title: CryptoPunks, Otherdeed, Meebits Are The Real NFT Diamond Holders in 2023
entry.summary:
Despite the sharp contraction in the non-fungible token (NFT) market, CryptoPunks, Otherdeed, and Meebits owners are holding on to their assets. Data shared on August 23 shows that over 75% of major collections have not been traded, with an astounding 91% of all CryptoPunks not changing hands over the past eight months.
Meanwhile, 89% and 84% of Meebits and Otherdeed NFTs have not changed hands despite the cool-off in crypto asset prices and floor prices of leading collections.
CryptoPunks, Otherdeed Holders Not Selling In 2023
After crypto prices peaked in late 2021, the floor prices of top collections rose to record highs from late 2021 to early 2022. At one point, for instance, CryptoPunk #8857 sold for 2,000 ETH, which was worth $6.63 million as of September 2021.
Meanwhile, ‚Ä¶

entry.title: DEA gets duped: Agency loses $55K in address poisoning scam
Crypto Debacle: DEA‚Äôs $50,000 Seizure Ends Up In Scammer‚Äôs Hands
entry.summary:
According to a recent report by Forbes, the US Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA) has inadvertently transferred $50,000 worth of seized cryptocurrency to a hacker, who has amassed hundreds of thousands in Ethereum (ETH) within a few months.¬†
Earlier this year, the DEA seized approximately $500,000 in Tether, a stablecoin pegged 1:1 to the US dollar, from two Binance accounts suspected of being involved in illegal narcotics transactions.¬†
The funds were securely stored in DEA-controlled accounts, protected within a Trezor hardware-based wallet at a ‚Äúhighly secure‚Äù facility. However, the agency‚Äôs vigilance was soon compromised by a scammer who capitalized on a well-known crypto scam.
The Airdrop Crypto Deception
Monitoring the blockchain closely, the scammer identified a prime opportuni‚Ä¶

entry.title: BRICS Invites 6 Countries to Join, Including Saudi Arabia, UAE, Iran
entry.summary:
The BRICS economic bloc has invited six countries to become new members: Argentina, Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates. The BRICS leaders wrapped up their 15th annual summit on Thursday. ‚ÄúWe have reached agreement on the guiding principles, standards, criteria, and procedures of the BRICS expansion process,‚Äù said South Africa‚Äôs president.
BRICS to Become 11-Nation Bloc
On Thursday, the BRICS nations (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) wrapped up their 15th annual summit in Johannesburg and released their ‚ÄúJohannesburg II Declaration.‚Äù Russia will assume the 2024 BRICS Chairship and host the XVI BRICS Summit in the city of Kazan.
The economic bloc has decided to invite six countries to become new members: Argentina, Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Sa‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX Eyes Collaboration With Novogratz‚Äôs Galaxy To Safeguard Crypto Fortune
entry.summary:
In a recent development, bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX has enlisted the services of US-based crypto firm Galaxy as an advisor to assist in hedging and selling its crypto holdings, as per court filings submitted on Wednesday.
According to a Reuters report, the filing revealed that the primary objective of Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) hedging strategies is to mitigate FTX‚Äôs exposure to adverse price fluctuations before executing the sale.¬†
By implementing these measures, FTX aims to reduce its exposure to market volatility and potential losses, ultimately ensuring a more favorable environment for the eventual sale of its crypto assets.
FTX Outlines Clear Path To Recovery
Per the report, Galaxy, led by billionaire investor Mike Novogratz, will offer guidance on hedging stra‚Ä¶

entry.title: Founders of Crypto Mixer Tornado Cash Accused of Laundering $1 Billion
entry.summary:
The founders of the cryptocurrency mixing service Tornado Cash were charged Thursday with allegedly helping to launder more than $1 billion in digital currency, including funds taken by North Korean hackers.
Department of Justice: ‚ÄòYou Can‚Äôt Hide From Us Behind a Keyboard ‚Äî Whether You‚Äôre a Hacker or Facilitator‚Äô
Roman Storm and Roman Semenov were indicted federally on charges of conspiracy to launder money, conspiracy to violate sanctions laws, and operation of an unlicensed money-transmitting business. Storm was arrested in Washington, and Semenov remains at large.
Prosecutors allege that Storm and Semenov intentionally designed Tornado Cash to let cyber criminals anonymize transfers of funds on the blockchain. The system was used to launder more than $1 billion in digital currency, violating U.S. sanctions, the indictment says.
Earlier this spring, Tornado Cash is believed to have aided in laundering part of the $600 million stolen by hackers sponsored by North Korea in a March attack on the Ronin Network, an Ethereum sidechain. Although the company had already put sanctions screening in place, Storm and Semenov reportedly used deceptive compliance practices to keep processing illicit transactions, prosecutors said.
‚ÄúAs alleged, Tornado Cash was an infamous cryptocurrency mixer that laundered more than $1 billion in criminal proceeds and violated U.S. sanctions,‚Äù Damian Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York said in a statement. ‚ÄúRoman Storm and Roman Semenov allegedly operated Tornado Cash and knowingly facilitated this money laundering.‚Äù
These charges come amid a national cryptocurrency crackdown by the Department of Justice aimed at those facilitating cybercrime and evading sanctions. This action follows last year‚Äôs imprisonment of Tornado Cash developer Alexey Pertsev by Dutch officials.
What do you think about the charges against the Tornado Cash founders? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

The Ethereum-based decentralized platform, Tornado Cash, has been at the center of controversy since US authorities targeted it. The case continues to evolve without positive developments for the platform or its co-founders.

Splicing is expected to tackle a persistent challenge within the Lightning network‚Äîliquidity constraints. These constraints have long been cited as a barrier to widespread adoption, impeding the seamless flow of transactions. With Splicing, Blockstream aims to alleviate these liquidity challenges, ultimately leading to more affordable and reliable transactions for Lightning users. entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Game‚Äôs Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallel‚Äôs closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mashup
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mashup of Titanfall and Destiny.

entry.title: 'Give Projects a Chance,' Says Aurory's Michael Natoli on NFT Game Challenges
entry.summary: Aurory is an NFT-driven game franchise that started life on Solana and is expanding to other chains. Decrypt's Jason Nelson spoke with Aurory Head of Marketing Michael Natoli at Solana's PlayGG event, where Natoli shared his thoughts on the challenges that blockchain games face in reaching players.

entry.title: Solana Is Only Network Ready for Gaming: Solana Foundation's Johnny Lee
entry.summary: Solana Foundation General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Solana network will tackle the scaling problem that blockchain games pose for the industry.

entry.title: Com2uS Is Going "Full Speed" on Crypto Gaming: Kyu Lee
entry.summary: Kyu Lee is the President of game studio Com2uS USA. In an interview, he shares the studio's approach to Web3 and crypto gaming with Decrypt GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Building a Discord Game with AI and Blockchain: 'Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos' Creative Lead Alex Finden
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson interviews Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos Creative Director Alex Finden at the Solana PlayGG event in San Diego, California.
